title: Orcish spear
data:
| ) [![Orcish spear.png](/images/2/28/Orcish_spear.png)](/wiki/File:Orcish_spear.png) |                                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ |
| Name                                                                                | orcish spear                                           |
| Appearance                                                                          | crude spear                                            |
| Damage vs. small                                                                    | 1d5                                                    |
| Damage vs. large                                                                    | 1d8                                                    |
| To-hit bonus                                                                        | +0                                                     |
| Weapon skill                                                                        | [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")                           |
| Size                                                                                | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")            |
| Base price                                                                          | 3 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                              | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                            |
| Material                                                                            | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                              |

An **orcish spear** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") one-handed weapon that uses the [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") and is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **crude spear** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

[Orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters start the game with knowledge of the orcish spear. Any orcish character that would start the game with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") will start with an orcish spear instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution occurs.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Orcish spears make up about 1.3% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock orcish spears.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a 13⁄1160 chance (just above 1%) of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a stack of 1-4 orcish spears as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

The orcish spear is the weakest among spear weapons against smaller monsters, but still deals respectable damage against larger ones. As no [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") monsters of any kind generate with them, they are also somewhat harder to come across compared to the stronger spears.

## History

The orcish spear first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Variants generally make orcish spears more common compared to *NetHack*.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") and [kobolds](/wiki/Kobold_\(monster_class\) "Kobold (monster class)") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a small stack of orcish spears.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

[Elfrist](/wiki/Elfrist "Elfrist") is a chaotic [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") orcish spear that can be created by naming a regular orcish spear, making it the orcish counterpart to [Sting](/wiki/Sting "Sting") and (particularly) [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist").

All of the above information applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), orcish spears deal 1d6 damage to small monster and 1d12 damage to large monsters, with a -1 to-hit penalty - its weight is also lowered to 25 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Mordor orcs, Uruk-hai and orc-captains have an effective 1⁄3 chance of either generating with a scimitar (2⁄3 chance) or a stack of orcish spears (⁄3 chance).

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [goblin outriders](/wiki/Goblin_outrider "Goblin outrider") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a stack of orcish spears, and orcish [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") and [watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") have an effective 1⁄3 chance of generating with a stack of orcish spears.

An orcish spear can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining 2 [orcish arrows](/wiki/Orcish_arrow "Orcish arrow") and an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), successfully [untrapping](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap") a [spear trap](/index.php?title=Spear_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spear trap (page does not exist)") has a chance of generating an intact orcish spear.

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") an orcish spear will produce a spear, and upgrading a [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear") will produce an orcish spear. Hack'EM also incorporates Elfrist from SLASH'EM.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, an orcish spear can be combined with a [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail") to create an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 214](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L214): *Race-based substitutions for initial orc inventory*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 275](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L275): *stackable weapons for player monsters*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 814](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line814 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 855](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line855 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Orcish spear

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)
Name orcish spear
Appearance crude spear
Damage vs. small 1d5
Damage vs. large 1d8
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill spear
Size one-handed
Base price 3 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 30
Material iron

An orcish spear is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is a stackable one-handed weapon that uses the spear skill and is made of iron, and appears as a crude spear when unidentified.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 EvilHack
    • 4.5 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Generation

Orcish characters start the game with knowledge of the orcish spear. Any orcish character that would start the game with a spear will start with an orcish spear instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution occurs.[1]

Orcish spears make up about 1.3% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon shops and general stores can stock orcish spears.

Player monsters, including those generated on the Astral Plane, have a 13⁄1160 chance (just above 1%) of being generated with a stack of 1-4 orcish spears as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[2][3]

Strategy

The orcish spear is the weakest among spear weapons against smaller monsters, but still deals respectable damage against larger ones. As no orcish monsters of any kind generate with them, they are also somewhat harder to come across compared to the stronger spears.

History

The orcish spear first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

Variants generally make orcish spears more common compared to NetHack.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, Mordor orcs and kobolds have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a small stack of orcish spears.[4][5]

Elfrist is a chaotic artifact orcish spear that can be created by naming a regular orcish spear, making it the orcish counterpart to Sting and (particularly) Orcrist.

All of the above information applies to SlashTHEM.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, orcish spears deal 1d6 damage to small monster and 1d12 damage to large monsters, with a -1 to-hit penalty - its weight is also lowered to 25 aum.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, Mordor orcs, Uruk-hai and orc-captains have an effective 1⁄3 chance of either generating with a scimitar (2⁄3 chance) or a stack of orcish spears (⁄3 chance).

EvilHack

In EvilHack, goblin outriders have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a stack of orcish spears, and orcish soldiers and watchmen have an effective 1⁄3 chance of generating with a stack of orcish spears.

An orcish spear can be created at a forge by combining 2 orcish arrows and an orcish dagger.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, successfully untrapping a spear trap has a chance of generating an intact orcish spear.

Upgrading an orcish spear will produce a spear, and upgrading a dwarvish spear will produce an orcish spear. Hack'EM also incorporates Elfrist from SLASH'EM.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, an orcish spear can be combined with a flail to create an aklys.

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 214: Race-based substitutions for initial orc inventory
  2. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155: 1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds
  3. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 275: stackable weapons for player monsters
  4. ↑ makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 814
  5. ↑ makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 855

An '''orcish spear''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[stackable]] one-handed weapon that uses the [[spear]] [[skill]] and is made of [[iron]], and appears as a '''crude spear''' when [[Identification|unidentified]].

==Generation==
[[Orc (starting race)|Orcish]] characters start the game with knowledge of the orcish spear. Any orcish character that would start the game with a [[spear]] will start with an orcish spear instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution occurs.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|214|nethack=3.6.7|comment=Race-based substitutions for initial orc inventory}}

Orcish spears make up about 1.3% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon [[shop]]s and general stores can stock orcish spears.

[[Player monster]]s, including those generated on the [[Astral Plane]], have a {{frac|13|1160}} chance (just above 1%) of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a stack of 1-4 orcish spears as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|155|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2}} to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|275|nethack=3.6.7|comment=stackable weapons for player monsters}}

==Strategy==
The orcish spear is the weakest among spear weapons against smaller monsters, but still deals respectable damage against larger ones. As no [[Orc (monster attribute)|orcish]] monsters of any kind generate with them, they are also somewhat harder to come across compared to the stronger spears.

==History==
The orcish spear first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
Variants generally make orcish spears more common compared to ''NetHack''.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[Mordor orc]]s and [[Kobold (monster class)|kobolds]] have a {{frac|4}} chance of generating with a small stack of orcish spears.{{refsrc|makemon.c|814|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|makemon.c|855|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

[[Elfrist]] is a chaotic [[artifact]] orcish spear that can be created by naming a regular orcish spear, making it the orcish counterpart to [[Sting]] and (particularly) [[Orcrist]].

All of the above information applies to [[SlashTHEM]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], orcish spears deal 1d6 damage to small monster and 1d12 damage to large monsters, with a -1 to-hit penalty - its weight is also lowered to 25 [[aum]].

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], Mordor orcs, Uruk-hai and orc-captains have an effective {{frac|3}} chance of either generating with a scimitar ({{frac|2|3}} chance) or a stack of orcish spears ({{frac||3}} chance).

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], [[goblin outrider]]s have a {{frac|3}} chance of generating with a stack of orcish spears, and orcish [[soldier]]s and [[watchmen]] have an effective {{frac|3}} chance of generating with a stack of orcish spears.

An orcish spear can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining 2 [[orcish arrow]]s and an [[orcish dagger]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], successfully [[untrap]]ping a [[spear trap]] has a chance of generating an intact orcish spear.

[[Upgrading]] an orcish spear will produce a spear, and upgrading a [[dwarvish spear]] will produce an orcish spear. Hack'EM also incorporates Elfrist from SLASH'EM.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, an orcish spear can be combined with a [[flail]] to create an [[aklys]].
